item.text: It seemed like a good idea to Darius to appoint over the kingdom 120 satraps who would be in charge of the entire kingdom.

<st data-num="05924 04481">Over</st> them would be <st data-num="08532" class="">three</st> <st data-num="05632" class="">supervisors</st>, <st data-num="02298" class="">one</st> <st data-num="04481" class="">of</st> <st data-num="01768" class="">whom</st> was <st data-num="01841" class="">Daniel</st>. <st data-num="0459" class="">These</st> <st data-num="0324" class="">satraps</st> <st data-num="01768 01934">were</st> <st data-num="03052 02941">accountable</st><n id="1" /> to them, so that the <st data-num="04430" class="">king’s</st> interests might <st data-num="03809" class="">not</st> <st data-num="01934 05142">incur damage</st>.

<st data-num="0116" class="">Now</st> <st data-num="01836" class="">this</st> <st data-num="01841" class="">Daniel</st> <st data-num="01934" class="">was</st> <st data-num="05330" class="">distinguishing</st> himself <st data-num="05922" class="">above</st> the other <st data-num="05632" class="">supervisors</st> and the <st data-num="0324" class="">satraps</st>, <st data-num="03606 06903 01768">for</st> he had an <st data-num="03493" class="">extraordinary</st> <st data-num="07308" class="">spirit</st>. In fact, the <st data-num="04430" class="">king</st> <st data-num="06246" class="">intended</st> to <st data-num="06966" class="">appoint</st> him <st data-num="05922" class="">over</st> the <st data-num="03606" class="">entire</st> <st data-num="04437" class="">kingdom</st>.

<st data-num="0116" class="">Consequently</st> the <st data-num="05632" class="">supervisors</st> and <st data-num="0324" class="">satraps</st> <st data-num="01934" class="">were</st> <st data-num="01156" class="">trying</st> to <st data-num="07912" class="">find</st><n id="1" /> some <st data-num="05931" class="">pretext</st> against <st data-num="01841" class="">Daniel</st> <st data-num="06655" class="">in connection with</st> <st data-num="04437" class="">administrative matters</st>.<n id="2" /> But they were <st data-num="03809 03202">unable</st> to <st data-num="07912" class="">find</st> <st data-num="03606" class="">any</st> such <st data-num="07844" class="">damaging</st> <st data-num="05931" class="">evidence</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="03606 06903 01768">because</st> <st data-num="01932" class="">he</st> was <st data-num="0540" class="">trustworthy</st> and <st data-num="07912 05922">guilty</st> of <st data-num="03606 03809">no</st> <st data-num="07960" class="">negligence</st> or <st data-num="07844" class="">corruption</st>.<n id="4" />
So these men concluded, “We won’t find any pretext against this man Daniel unless it is in connection with the law of his God.”
So these supervisors and satraps came by collusion to the king and said to him, “O King Darius, live forever!

To <st data-num="03606" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="05632" class="">supervisors</st> of the <st data-num="04437" class="">kingdom</st>, the <st data-num="05460" class="">prefects</st>, <st data-num="0324" class="">satraps</st>, <st data-num="01907" class="">counselors</st>, and <st data-num="06347" class="">governors</st> it <st data-num="03272" class="">seemed like a good idea</st> for a <st data-num="04430" class="">royal</st> <st data-num="07010" class="">edict</st> to be <st data-num="06966" class="">issued</st> and an <st data-num="0633" class="">interdict</st> to be <st data-num="08631" class="">enforced</st>. <st data-num="05705" class="">For the next</st> <st data-num="08533" class="">30</st> <st data-num="03118" class="">days</st> <st data-num="03606" class="">anyone</st> <st data-num="01768" class="">who</st> <st data-num="01156 01159">prays</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="04481" class="">to</st> <st data-num="03606" class="">any</st> <st data-num="0426" class="">god</st> or <st data-num="0606" class="">human</st> <st data-num="03861" class="">other</st> <st data-num="04481" class="">than</st> you, O <st data-num="04430" class="">king</st>, should be <st data-num="07412" class="">thrown</st> into a <st data-num="01358" class="">den</st> of <st data-num="0744" class="">lions</st>.

<st data-num="03705" class="">Now</st> let the <st data-num="04430" class="">king</st> <st data-num="06966" class="">issue</st> a <st data-num="07560 03792">written</st> <st data-num="0633" class="">interdict</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="01768" class="">so that</st> it <st data-num="03809" class="">cannot</st> be <st data-num="08133" class="">altered</st>, according to the <st data-num="01882" class="">law</st> of the <st data-num="04076" class="">Medes</st> and <st data-num="06540" class="">Persians</st>, <st data-num="01768" class="">which</st> <st data-num="03809" class="">cannot</st> be <st data-num="05709" class="">changed</st>.”<n id="2" />
So King Darius issued the written interdict.

When Daniel realized that a written decree had been issued, he entered his home, where the windows in his upper room opened toward Jerusalem. Three times daily he was kneeling and offering prayers and thanks to his God just as he had been accustomed to do previously.

<st data-num="0116" class="">Then</st> <st data-num="0479" class="">those</st> <st data-num="01400" class="">officials</st> who had gone to the king<n id="1" /> <st data-num="07284" class="">came by collusion</st> and <st data-num="07912" class="">found</st> <st data-num="01841" class="">Daniel</st> <st data-num="01156" class="">praying</st> and <st data-num="02604" class="">asking for help</st> <st data-num="06925" class="">before</st> his <st data-num="0426" class="">God</st>.

<st data-num="0116" class="">So</st> they <st data-num="07127" class="">approached</st> the <st data-num="04430" class="">king</st> and <st data-num="0560" class="">said</st> <st data-num="06925" class="">to</st> him,<n id="1" /> “Did you <st data-num="03809" class="">not</st> <st data-num="07560" class="">issue</st> an <st data-num="0633" class="">edict</st> to the effect <st data-num="01768" class="">that</st> for the <st data-num="05705" class="">next</st> <st data-num="08533" class="">30</st> <st data-num="03118" class="">days</st> <st data-num="03606 0606">anyone</st> <st data-num="01768" class="">who</st> <st data-num="01156" class="">prays</st> <st data-num="04481" class="">to</st> <st data-num="03606" class="">any</st> <st data-num="0426" class="">god</st> or <st data-num="0606" class="">human</st> <st data-num="03861" class="">other</st> <st data-num="04481" class="">than</st> to you, O <st data-num="04430" class="">king</st>, would be <st data-num="07412" class="">thrown</st> into a <st data-num="01358" class="">den</st> of <st data-num="0744" class="">lions</st>?” The <st data-num="04430" class="">king</st> <st data-num="06032 0560">replied</st>, “<st data-num="04406" class="">That</st> is <st data-num="03330" class="">correct</st>,<n id="2" /> according to the <st data-num="01882" class="">law</st> of the <st data-num="04076" class="">Medes</st> and <st data-num="06540" class="">Persians</st>, <st data-num="01768" class="">which</st> <st data-num="03809" class="">cannot</st> be <st data-num="05709" class="">changed</st>.”
Then they said to the king, “Daniel, who is one of the captives from Judah, pays no attention to you, O king, or to the edict that you issued. Three times daily he offers his prayer.”
When the king heard this, he was very upset and began thinking about how he might rescue Daniel. Until late afternoon he was struggling to find a way to rescue him.

<st data-num="0116" class="">Then</st> <st data-num="0479" class="">those</st> <st data-num="01400" class="">men</st> <st data-num="07284" class="">came by collusion</st> <st data-num="05922" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="04430" class="">king</st> and<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0560" class="">said</st> to <st data-num="04430" class="">him</st>,<n id="2" /> “<st data-num="03046" class="">Recall</st>,<n id="3" /> O <st data-num="04430" class="">king</st>, <st data-num="01768" class="">that</st> it is a <st data-num="01882" class="">law</st> of the <st data-num="04076" class="">Medes</st> and <st data-num="06540" class="">Persians</st> <st data-num="01768" class="">that</st> <st data-num="03606 03809">no</st> <st data-num="0633" class="">edict</st> or <st data-num="07010" class="">decree</st> <st data-num="01768" class="">that</st> the <st data-num="04430" class="">king</st> <st data-num="06966" class="">issues</st> can be <st data-num="08133" class="">changed</st>.”

<st data-num="0116" class="">So</st> the <st data-num="04430" class="">king</st> <st data-num="0560" class="">gave the order</st>,<n id="1" /> and <st data-num="01841" class="">Daniel</st> was <st data-num="0858" class="">brought</st> and <st data-num="07412" class="">thrown</st> into a <st data-num="01358" class="">den</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="01768" class="">of</st> <st data-num="0744" class="">lions</st>. The <st data-num="04430" class="">king</st> <st data-num="06032" class="">consoled</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="01841" class="">Daniel</st> by <st data-num="0560" class="">saying</st>, “Your <st data-num="0426 01932">God</st> <st data-num="01768" class="">whom</st> <st data-num="0607" class="">you</st> <st data-num="08411" class="">continually</st> <st data-num="06399" class="">serve</st> will <st data-num="07804" class="">rescue</st> you!”

Then <st data-num="02298" class="">a</st> <st data-num="069" class="">stone</st> was <st data-num="0858" class="">brought</st> and <st data-num="07761" class="">placed</st> <st data-num="05922" class="">over</st> the <st data-num="06433" class="">opening</st><n id="1" /> to the <st data-num="01358" class="">den</st>. The <st data-num="04430" class="">king</st> <st data-num="02857" class="">sealed</st><n id="2" /> it with his <st data-num="05824" class="">signet ring</st> and with <st data-num="05824" class="">those</st><n id="3" /> of his <st data-num="07261" class="">nobles</st> <st data-num="01768" class="">so that</st> <st data-num="03809 06640">nothing</st> could be <st data-num="08133" class="">changed</st> with regard to <st data-num="01841" class="">Daniel</st>.
Then the king departed to his palace. But he spent the night without eating, and no diversions were brought to him. He was unable to sleep.
In the morning, at the earliest sign of daylight, the king got up and rushed to the lions’ den.
As he approached the den, he called out to Daniel in a worried voice, “Daniel, servant of the living God, was your God whom you continually serve able to rescue you from the lions?”
Then Daniel spoke to the king, “O king, live forever!
My God sent his angel and closed the lions’ mouths so that they have not harmed me because I was found to be innocent before him. Nor have I done any harm to you, O king.”
Then the king was delighted and gave an order to haul Daniel up from the den. So Daniel was hauled up out of the den. He had no injury of any kind because he had trusted in his God.

The king gave another order, and those men who had maliciously accused Daniel were brought and thrown into the lions’ den—they, their children, and their wives. They did not even reach the bottom of the den before the lions overpowered them and crushed all their bones.
Then King Darius wrote to all the peoples, nations, and language groups who were living in all the land: “Peace and prosperity!

I have issued an edict that throughout all the dominion of my kingdom people are to revere and fear the God of Daniel.

“For he is the living God;

he endures forever.

His kingdom will not be destroyed;

his authority is forever.

He rescues and delivers

and performs signs and wonders

in the heavens and on the earth.

He has rescued Daniel from the power of the lions!”
So this Daniel prospered during the reign of Darius and the reign of Cyrus the Persian.
